alert.note: Alert for Santa Clarita Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 31 at 9:06PM PST until January 01 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For tonight, north winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected, strongest in the Interstate 5 corridor. Then winds shifting to northeast Saturday morning with gusts in the 35 to 40 mph range, strongest in the Highway 14 corridor. * WHERE...Santa Clarita Valley. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Major roadways impacted by the strong winds include interstate 5 and highway 14.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
